snippet: Mayor Bill de Blasio called the aide, Rachel Noerdlinger, “a good public servant” and said she did not intend to deceive by failing to disclose her relationship.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio expresses 'absolute faith' in Rachel Noerdlinger, a top City Hall aide whose failure to disclose a troubled boyfriend on a background check prompted a formal city inquiry; says there was no intent to deceive on the part of Noerdlinger, chief of staff to de Blasio’s wife Chirlane McCray.
lead_paragraph: Mayor Bill de Blasio called the aide, Rachel Noerdlinger, “a good public servant” and said she did not intend to deceive by failing to disclose her relationship.

headline.main: De Blasio Stands Behind Aide Who Omitted Boyfriend on Background Check Form
headline.print_headline: Mayor Says He Has Faith in Character of a Top Aide
